text: Scrivner's Drive-In was a drive-in located on the corner of Sunset and Cahuenga in Los Angeles, California, United States. It was owned by Paul Scrivner, and was a popular hangout for local teens in the 1950s. The drive-in gained notoriety when Los Angeles radio personality Art Laboe began to broadcast his live radio show from its parking lot.Bradley, R. (2015). Calling Art. The Virginia Quarterly Review, 91(3), 156-162,8. Scrivner's had a second location on Western and Imperial Highway in Los Angeles. The drive-in is no longer there, and in its place sits a Jack in the Box across from independent music store Amoeba. ==References== Category:Drive-in restaurants Category:Defunct restaurants in Greater Los Angeles Category:Restaurants in Los Angeles
